title: Turia Pitt marvels over fiancé Michael Hoskin's outfit
text:
She's expecting her second child with fiancé Michael Hoskin.

And on Saturday, Turia Pitt, 32, covered her burgeoning baby bump in a Hawaiian-themed ensemble, while attending a friend's island wedding with her groom-to-be.

The burns survivor shared a loved-up photo of the pair to Instagram and poked lighthearted fun at their attire.

'Beating me in the Tropicana stakes!' Burns survivor Turia Pitt, 32, praised fiancé Michael Hoskin's outfit, as they attended a friend's island wedding on Saturday

Turia's multi-coloured Hawaiian frock featured spaghetti straps and wrap detail.

The activist allowed her brunette locks to flow freely, and accessorised with a shell necklace.

Turia wrapped one arm around Michael, who wore a maroon and blue flower print shirt and pants.

Celebrations: Turia covered her burgeoning baby bump in a multi-coloured frock with spaghetti straps and wrap detail. Pictured with friends at the wedding

Social: Turia is pictured with two new friends at the wedding

'Once again Michael beats me in the Tropicana wardrobe stakes,' Turia wrote in the caption, adding: 'Before you ask, the necklace I'm wearing is actually a one-off, super special, bespoke design created by Hakavai (their son).

'He took one of my headbands, ripped off half the shells and then put a ring on it.'

Turia and Michael are proud parents to one-year-old son Hakavai, and are expecting their second child in August.

Growing family: Turia and Michael are proud parents to one-year-old son Hakavai (all pictured), and are expecting their second child in August

The couple announced the happy news with what Turia described as a 'Beyoncé-inspired video montage' on Instagram in August.

'When Michael and I want to share big news, I insist on creating a Beyoncé-inspired video montage. Baby #2, we can't wait to meet you,' she captioned the sweet clip.

She added: 'PS I promise we'll find you a more appropriate name soon'.

Turia suffered horrific burns when she was caught in a wildfire in 2011 during an ultramarathon.

Growing family: The couple announced the happy news with what Turia described as a 'Beyoncé-inspired video montage' on Instagram in August. Pictured in September

She told Stellar magazine in October last year, that the arrival of her first child shifted all of the goal posts in her life.

'I no longer have any desire to do an Ironman,' Turia told the publication.

'Having a baby has changed me and when you become a mum you quickly realise your whole life fits in around your kids.

'I don't want to be out running for five hours straight. I know how precious life is and I'd rather be with my son,' she continued.
description: She's expecting her second child with fiancé Michael Hoskin.
authors: Kristy Johnson For Daily Mail Australia
